relevant_findings.neurological_examination: Severe involuntary movement of bilateral extremities noted on admission; remaining neurological examination was normal. Mild choreatic movement persisted in the upper extremities.
relevant_findings.brain_imaging: Brain CT showed mild atrophy of the bilateral nucleus caudatus and corpus striatum; MRI on day 17 revealed bilateral atrophy of the caudate nucleus with enlargement of the frontal horns.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Severe involuntary movements resolved within 48 hours, but very mild choreatic movements of the bilateral upper extremities persisted.

relevant_findings.neurological_examination: Mild slow eye movements noted later; no dysarthria and gait disturbance observed.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Chorea became severe gradually over follow-up years, difficulty in insulin injection and blood glucose monitoring was noted.
